column1: You can change the details of this member's account here.
column2: You can change the details of this member's account here.

Facilitating relationships between members is essential to building a successful social network. There are several different types of connections that can exist between members. Use this page to determine how members will associate with each other. Note that although we refer to these relationships as "friendships" in this control panel, you should use a word that best fits with your social network's theme. For example, if you are running a business-oriented social network, you may want to change this word to "connections".
Do you want to enable user friendship functionality on your website? Note that if you select "no", none of the other settings on this page will apply.

Your social network can allow either one-way or two-way friendships. The default setting is two-way friendships as this is typical for most social networks. One-way friendships mean that when MemberA adds MemberB, MemberB will appear on MemberA's friend list but NOT the reverse.

Your social network can allow either verified or unverified friendship requests. The default setting is verified friendship requests as this is typical for most social networks. Unverified friendship requests mean that when MemberA adds MemberB as a friend, MemberA and MemberB will immediately become friends without any confirmation.

Using friend lists, your members can organize their friends under various labels that they create. They can then use these lists to send messages to multiple friends and customize their privacy settings.

column1: Yes, users can group their friends into lists
column2: Yes, users can group their friends into lists

column1: No, do not allow friend lists
column2: No, do not allow friend lists

column1: Specify what privacy options will be available to members in this level.
column2: Specify what privacy options will be available to members in this level.
If set to "yes", members can block other members from sending them private messages, requesting their friendship, and viewing their profile. This helps fight spam and network abuse.

column1: Can this member level be blocked?
column2: Can this member level be blocked?

Do you want to allow other users to block members of this member level? If you choose No, then members of this member level can not be blocked by any member on your site. You can use this feature to disable blocking of admins, super admins, moderators, of any other member level as per your requirements.

Your members can choose from any of the options checked below when they decide who can see their profile. If you do not check any options, settings will default to the last saved configuration. If you select only one option, members of this level will not have a choice.

Your members can choose from any of the options checked below when they decide who can post on their profile. If you do not check any options, settings will default to the last saved configuration. If you select only one option, members of this level will not have a choice.
If set to "yes", members will have the option of changing their username. If usernames are not enabled, this setting has no effect.
Do you want to allow members to message each other?
You can choose to use an editor to help format and add media to your messages or use the default plain textbox with buttons to add media and share when allowed.

column1: If set to "yes", members will have the option of deleting their accounts.
column2: If set to "yes", members will have the option of deleting their accounts.

If you have selected YES, members will be given the option of choosing a unique username. If you have selected NO, their user id will be used in the URL instead. This username is also their username which is displayed in the Manage Members section for each user.

column1: Yes, allow members to choose a username.
column2: Yes, allow members to choose a username.

If you have selected YES, members will automatically be enabled when they signup. If you have selected NO, you will need to manually enable members through the Manage Members page. Members that are not enabled can not login. Note: This setting does not work with the Phone Number sign up. Members who will sign up with the Phone Number will automatically be enabled.

column1: No, do not enable members upon signup.
column2: No, do not enable members upon signup.

column1: Yes, make members agree to your terms of service on signup.
column2: Yes, make members agree to your terms of service on signup.

column1: No, members will not be shown a terms of service checkbox on signup.
column2: No, members will not be shown a terms of service checkbox on signup.
Require members to agree to your terms of service?  You can modifying your terms of service by editing the _CORE_TERMS_OF_SERVICE language variable in the application/languages/en/core.csv file.
Send Admin and email when a new user signs up? If set to YES, admin will be recieve an email with information about new user.

Do you want to turn off public signups and only allow invited members to signup? If yes, you can choose to have either admins and members invite new members, or just admins. If set to yes, an invite code will be required on the signup page.  Note that if you choose to allow only admins to invite new members then the 'Invite Your Friends' signup step will be disabled, even if you have enabled it elsewhere.

column1: Yes, admins and members must invite new members before they can signup.
column2: Yes, admins and members must invite new members before they can signup.

column1: Yes, admins must invite new members before they can signup.
column2: Yes, admins must invite new members before they can signup.

column1: No, disable the invite only feature.
column2: No, disable the invite only feature.

Should each invite code be bound to each invited email address? If set to NO, anyone with a valid invite code can signup regardless of their email address. If set to YES, anyone with a valid invite code that matches an email address that was invited can signup.

column1: Yes, check that a member's email address was invited.
column2: Yes, check that a member's email address was invited.

column1: No, anyone with an invite code can signup.
column2: No, anyone with an invite code can signup.
Do you want members to invite their friends during the signup process?  Note that this setting will be ignored if you've chosen to limit invitation privileges to admins only.

column1: Yes, include the "Invite Friends" step during signup.
column2: Yes, include the "Invite Friends" step during signup.

When new members sign up, they are led through a step-by-step process that helps them create an account and fill out their profile. You can customize most aspects of this sign-up process here. On the left, there is a list of steps that make up the sign-up process. You can change the order of these steps by clicking on the arrows and dragging up or down.

column1:
Your members will be asked to provide some information about themselves when joining the community or editing their profile. Create some profile questions that allow them to describe themselves in a way that relates to the theme of your community. To reorder the profile questions, click on their names and drag them up or down. If you want to show different sets of questions to different types of members, you can create multiple "profile types". This is useful, for example, if you want your community to have "fans" and "musicians", each with a different set of profile questions.
You can allow your members to change their profile types from Member Level Settings. You can also change individual user''s profile type from Manage Members settings."
column2:
Your members will be asked to provide some information about themselves when joining the community or editing their profile. Create some profile questions that allow them to describe themselves in a way that relates to the theme of your community. To reorder the profile questions, click on their names and drag them up or down. If you want to show different sets of questions to different types of members, you can create multiple "profile types". This is useful, for example, if you want your community to have "fans" and "musicians", each with a different set of profile questions.
You can allow your members to change their profile types from Member Level Settings. You can also change individual user''s profile type from Manage Members settings."

column2: Bulk Import Members Using CSV File

column2: Below settings will apply to all the members imported via uploaded csv file.

column1:
This page enables you to import Members on your website from CSV file. Please download the template file using the "Download Template File" button below. To start importing Members, click on the "Import Members" button.
Notes: See the points below and make sure the csv is created follows each one:
1. Do not add any new column in the downloaded template file.
2. The data in the file should be pipe ("|") separated and in same ordering as that of the template file.
3. We recommend you to import 100 Members from the csv file at a time.
4. File must be in .csv format Only.
5. If you are adding fields- First Name, Last Name, Gender (Male/Female/Other), Birthdate (yyyy-mm-dd), in csv file, then make sure you have added these fields in the profile type you will select while importing your csv file. This ensures that the data is properly mapped and not lost during the import process.
column2:
This page enables you to import Members on your website from CSV file. Please download the template file using the "Download Template File" button below. To start importing Members, click on the "Import Members" button.
Notes: See the points below and make sure the csv is created follows each one:
1. Do not add any new column in the downloaded template file.
2. The data in the file should be pipe ("|") separated and in same ordering as that of the template file.
3. We recommend you to import 100 Members from the csv file at a time.
4. File must be in .csv format Only.
5. If you are adding fields- First Name, Last Name, Gender (Male/Female/Other), Birthdate (yyyy-mm-dd), in csv file, then make sure you have added these fields in the profile type you will select while importing your csv file. This ensures that the data is properly mapped and not lost during the import process.
